title: LITERALLY inting on stream AND made a video about it. i reported him 4 times and still, no ban

embed.description: Revert Shaco I hope you like the video, enjoy! âš‰ Discord: https://discord.gg/shaclone âš‰ Music Channel: https://youtube.com/noisyclone âš‰ Merchandise/Shop: http://shaclone.com #revertshaco Clone Army Show Yourself - #CASY â¯ Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/shaclone â¯ Facebook: http://on.fb.me/1f0hcMa â¯ Instagram: https://instagram.com/realshaclone ðŸ¤¡ Subscribe and Become a Clone!

body:
gj riot {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}


btw i know on this video he got banned. but he has A LOT of accounts.  what i am asking is ban all of them. hes the worst kind of players.  it was just an example

replies.body: Naming and shaming Shaclone!
Is it really name shaming when his name is poblic anyways?

I was rly just meming. IDGAF. But I can definitely see riot taking down the post because of that rule. But honestly who cares that Shaclone went off the deep end. He's inting pre-30 games. What he's doing is way to obvious and eventually he'll run out of accounts.

Or riot will cave and revert shaco *lel*
They don't delete posts about streamers. If someone has opened them up to the public, then they're fair game.
Again... meming... 0.o
Doesn't look like you know what "meming" is.

> [{quoted}](name=letsfeedtogether,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qeBEXA5k,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-03-13T15:06:39.849+0000)
>
> Is it really name shaming when his name is poblic anyways?

I recall that the rule excludes popular streamers, but I don't see that stated in the Universal Rules. I'm fairly sure you're ok, but I will ask around.

Edit: I will say the last time I recall someone calling out a streamer, they didn't do their full research and ended up being wrong. So if anyone is going to have input on this, they should do some research.
Nah, he is the one deciding to show himself doing this publicly.
Holy shit I forgot Shaclone exists. I stopped watching when he started trying to meme and sell shitty merch with his questionable friends. His in game content was always very enjoyable though.

> [{quoted}](name=Warwick Main,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qeBEXA5k,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-03-13T13:28:03.947+0000)
>
> Holy shit I forgot Shaclone exists. I stopped watching when he started trying to meme and sell shitty merch with his questionable friends. His in game content was always very enjoyable though.

Look at him now. Inting in most of his games

> [{quoted}](name=General Matty,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qeBEXA5k,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-03-13T14:47:38.468+0000)
>
> Look at him now. Inting in most of his games

Best to report him now and then. YOu might never know when he gonna start inting and flaming if his game does not goes to his favour
I played against him in s3 as ezreal mid and he FLAMED  me all game for winning. Is he a riot employee or something? hes a known toxic troll since he first started playing. why is he not banned?

> [{quoted}](name=ImEzrealAsItGetz,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qeBEXA5k,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2019-03-13T19:06:39.597+0000)
>
> I played against him in s3 as ezreal mid and he FLAMED  me all game for winning. Is he a riot employee or something? hes a known toxic troll since he first started playing. why is he not banned?

He is banned, repeatedly and repeatedly. He just keeps making new accounts.

I mean, the best that can be done is to give Shaclone the same treatment they gave tyler.

An ID ban where they ban any account that they spot and confirm to be his. Tyler got this after several dozen accounts banned, with many of them banned for being bought accounts and other infractions besides poor behavior.

Personally, I think there's grounds for an ID ban since he quite literally stated his intentions in the video to continue acting this way. The question would then be, would Riot want to dedicate the time and effort to enforce the ID ban? His viewer count is pretty low, so it's not like he's being this horrible role model to large swaths of the player-base. But I don't think that should sway Riot's decision.
How did Tyler1 get an ID ban and not Shaclone? I know that T1 used to be very toxic, but Shaclone is arguably worse and has stated that he won't change his ways.

From what I understand, Tyler1 was actively encouraging his viewers to troll/int/afk as well. After his ban when people were sharing clips about T1 I realized I had quite a few games where people would copy his exact methods, or say they could get away with it because T1 got away with it.

I suspect that's the difference, and why Shaclone isn't ID banned.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qeBEXA5k,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2019-03-14T11:09:56.362+0000)
>
> From what I understand, Tyler1 was actively encouraging his viewers to troll/int/afk as well. After his ban when people were sharing clips about T1 I realized I had quite a few games where people would copy his exact methods, or say they could get away with it because T1 got away with it.
> 
> I suspect that's the difference, and why Shaclone isn't ID banned.

So, if people started to troll and rationalized it with "but Shaclone does it," imitating his methods - basically becoming copycat criminals - he'd be more likely to be banned? I can see why proliferation of that sort of behavior would be cause for concern, but I think people should be banned for their own actions, not those of others. Isn't that what we tell people who post chat logs and say "it was okay that I said those things because a teammate in that match said worse"?

I think it would build a case for looking into ID banning him, but I think Shaclone would still have to actively encourage it before Riot would take action. If imitation alone was good enough to earn someone a ban, then I doubt Kaceytron would have gotten as big as she did.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qeBEXA5k,comment-id=000c000000000000,timestamp=2019-03-14T12:39:21.672+0000)
>
> I think it would build a case for looking into ID banning him, but I think Shaclone would still have to actively encourage it before Riot would take action. If imitation alone was good enough to earn someone a ban, then I doubt Kaceytron would have gotten as big as she did.

Should an ID ban require encouragement of imitation as well as people actually doing so? Or merely the encouragement?

I think that there will always be a certain percentage of people who try to do what a streamer tells them to in game, for good or bad. It seems pretty unlikely that you could encourage people to troll and have no one take you up on it *unless* your sphere of influence is small enough it's not worth ID banning you anyway.

So if you're encouraging others to imitate *and* you've got enough viewers that it's a problem, then you could get an ID ban. Add to that what the [Support Page on ID Bans](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115013815928-Understanding-ID-Bans) says - you'd have to "show extreme aggression in chat and/or intentionally feed across many permanently banned accounts", which we're taking as a given in Shaclone's case.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=qeBEXA5k,comment-id=000c00000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-03-14T15:43:26.290+0000)
>
> I think that there will always be a certain percentage of people who try to do what a streamer tells them to in game, for good or bad. It seems pretty unlikely that you could encourage people to troll and have no one take you up on it *unless* your sphere of influence is small enough it's not worth ID banning you anyway.
> 
> So if you're encouraging others to imitate *and* you've got enough viewers that it's a problem, then you could get an ID ban. Add to that what the [Support Page on ID Bans](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115013815928-Understanding-ID-Bans) says - you'd have to "show extreme aggression in chat and/or intentionally feed across many permanently banned accounts", which we're taking as a given in Shaclone's case.

Wow, I didn't know there was actual documentation about ID bans. From that page, it looks like an ID ban is based on the player's actions, with no mention of what other players choose to do. Based on the described behavior, I'd say an ID ban would be appropriate here.

We talk about his inting but nobody mentions the serious stuff he's talking about.  I mean,  whether you agree with him or not,  he does have some points.  Especially about the gambling / tilt inducing accusations against rito,  which I think are dead wrong and delusional,  but that's the type of stuff that we should answer and discuss.  And what about his minigame rant,  and how the reward for side stepping a lux ult should be to get away, and not just avoid that portion of the damage / not have to contend with ludens or arcane comet or for abilities to have multiple parts.  I can see how a modern, faster paced league with more moving parts and dynamics can be a very good thing,  but I can also see how older MoBA players might not like it.  Instead of trolling around because "Hurr durr inter bad"  we should really afford him the utmost respect and discuss all of his ideas at length + give him a better platform

None of the stuff he's saying matters because he's _intentionally_ ruining games and griefing others because he's upset. 

 He's not making a grand statement, he's just being a jerkish troll and should be regarded as such.
Factually incorrect,  statements are definition ally correct within a vacuum.   Any trolling or protesting has no bearing in the objectivity of anything else he said.

In the _objectivity_ of what he's saying? It doesn't matter, you're right.

 It matters in the perception of the public eye which is something _he should be_ caring about and paying attention to if he:

 - Wants to be taken seriously 

 - Wants to be seen with any shred of credibility by Riot or potential viewers (ie. not like a jerkish troll, which he currently is.) 

 - Doesn't want to get banned

Of course.  That said,  this isn't only his problem or his error,  and Shaclone is a conveniently noisy example of disgruntled or corrupted players.  If we overlook him,  and players like him,  we are only cheating ourselves out of understanding and perspective.

Or, alternatively, if we overlook and disregard him entirely, he'll cease acting like a child and learn how to formulate a constructive argument like an adult.

 There's a difference between making a stand on a hot topic and acting like an immature brat because he isn't getting his way. Shaco has a 50%+ winrate in most ELOs with a fair pickrate, other champions have much more pressing matters that need to be attended to but he can't accept that or cope with it so he's going to ruin games to act like he's doing it for the "greater good."

He's a jerk. Plain and simple.
Why be so self righteous when you can learn from him and what he brings up?  You say he is not an adult but that shouldn't be used as an excuse to stoop beneath his level.

I'm not the one ruining games?

 I'm not the one intentionally feeding because I didn't get my way.

 I'm not the one **telling Riot to "suck my d--k" and that I'm going to "keep inting these idiots who deserve it."**

 If you honestly think me calling him a child for doing that is "self righteous", then I guess I'm self righteous and I'll wear that title with pride. 

 Dude is a toxic player who deserved the bans he got, deserves any future bans he gets, and should be ID banned immediately. Case closed.

You won't catch me losing my composure, objectivity and sense because some other player acted out in multiple games.  Just because someone else does something wrong doesn't mean that I,  as a player, shouldn't do the right and constructive thing myself. ;)

Yeah, because I'm just absolutely uncouth right now. I'm foaming from the mouth with rage and I haven't said anything of value that you're just overlooking because you dislike me calling him a jerk.
_____

"Shaco has a 50%+ winrate in most ELOs with a fair pickrate, other champions have much more pressing matters that need to be attended to but he can't accept that or cope with it so he's going to ruin games to act like he's doing it for the "greater good."

_______

"It matters in the perception of the public eye which is something he should be caring about and paying attention to if he:

- Wants to be taken seriously

- Wants to be seen with any shred of credibility by Riot or potential viewers (ie. not like a jerkish troll, which he currently is.)

- Doesn't want to get banned"

_______

"None of the stuff he's saying matters because he's intentionally ruining games and griefing others because he's upset."

_____

 Yep, totally not critically constructive at all.

 Whether you like it or not, he's toxic, he's griefing innocent players, and he's intentionally feeding games because he's upset. Most consider that to be more than just a "jerk" and I think I was pretty tame in my description of him.

 I'm done here. ;)

Actually,  I never claimed that I dislike you calling him a jerk and I am not exactly a shaclone fan at all.  I literally discovered him by the linked video in this thread.  You know what else I don't do?  Project myself unto others or do assumptions.  Good luck buddy ;)

What I learned from him that its okay to treat your team-mates like shit because someones being rude to you/you aren't doing well in a game/your team-mates aren't perfect

Very cool, Shaclone!

Other people learned Shaco's damage foresight, itemization, skill orders and history.  People learned about patience in solo queue and some (sometimes even right) victory conditions that shaclone often calls minigames.  Also critical thinking and he is an example of an acceptable user gone tilt,  he's worthy of a case study. Not only do people learn about the game,  but we see things concerning what is right and wrong with the game in question + some of it's players.  Honestly,  I heard people talk about why Riot should sponsor a 12 episode TV series on the life and thoughts of shaclone but if we are going to go that route,  it should be on riot's own youtube channel so we can link it to the home page of the LoL client.
Now if you want to call him a jerkish troll,  you shouldn't stoop beneath his level.  Remember that.
dang dude you said this person a him without asking, before you address an individual you should ask them if its okay to talk about them, stop stooping to their level
Yikes.
I played against him in s3 as ezreal mid in a normal game and he FLAMED  me all game for winning. Is he a riot employee or something? hes a known toxic troll since he first started playing.
Where is the evidence? I don't see any feeding videos?
i guess youre joking

Well they banned tyler1 on IP before. why not do the same for this troll? not a personal grudge. but people who watch this trolling quite motivate them to do the same? just an opinion. no need to throw rocks at me {{sticker:sg-janna}}
I used to like his contents and gameplays. Till he start acting like a cry baby when the game do not goes to his plan then start inting. Thats when i gave up watching his videos.....

Riot. Fix. This. Shit. 

 He is intentionally ruining games for your player. Are you okay with this because he makes you a lot of money?

iirc he has been in the spotlight for inting/trolling quite a bit, but like sure he is popular gets views and stuff like that and he has quite a bit of supporters. Riot is Riot c:  they will do what they want when they want c:

ngl if it would make ap shaco top a thing again, revert shacman.

as for shaclone, y'all care too much about a player most of you prolly never had in your game before. The people that get matched will report him and he'll get banned in time, then he'll make a new account and the cycle goes on.

"but ID ban" cuz that stopped tyler right?

Welcome to Riot Games, where any renowned streamer guy, who brings advertisement, exposure no matter how toxic he is, gets free passes from the company. It's so sad that "being toxic" since S6 started to be a cool thing, when they gave full exposure to tyler1 (who got banned later on). Especially since this game was one of the first in my recent memory to confront this video game toxicity problem, sadly they fallen into their own pit  that they tried to crawl out of and turned a blind eye on any high elo toxic behaviour. (Hello Meteos, Dyrus, IWillDominate). It's over....This game needs to be put out of it's misery already.
I think the shaco rework is a good one
